meanings.definition: The quality of being skewed or asymmetrical.
meanings.sent1: The skewness of the painting gave it a unique and interesting look.
meanings.sent2: The data set showed a noticeable skewness towards higher values.
meanings.sent3: The skewness of the cake made it lean to one side, looking like it was about to fall over.
meanings.sent4: Her sense of humor had a delightful skewness that always kept us entertained.
meanings.sent5: The skewness of the tree branches created a beautiful, natural pattern against the sky.

meanings.definition: A measure of the asymmetry of a probability distribution.
meanings.sent1: The statistician calculated the skewness of the data to understand its distribution better.
meanings.sent2: The skewness of the graph indicated a lack of symmetry in the data set.
meanings.sent3: The skewness of the weather forecast made it difficult to predict if it would rain or shine.
meanings.sent4: The skewness of the situation added an unexpected twist to the outcome.
meanings.sent5: The skewness of the road ahead made it challenging to navigate through the winding path.
